questions.question: What is the correct way to link a CSS file to an HTML document?
questions.explanation: The <link> tag is used to link an external CSS file to an HTML document. The correct syntax is '<link rel='stylesheet' type='text/css' href='styles.css'>'. The 'rel' attribute specifies the relationship, and 'href' specifies the path to the stylesheet.

questions.question: In JavaScript, what is the output of the following code: console.log(typeof null)?
questions.explanation: In JavaScript, the 'typeof' operator returns 'object' for the 'null' value. This is an acknowledged error in JavaScript's design.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a hyperlink in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <a> (anchor) tag is used to create hyperlinks in HTML. The 'href' attribute specifies the URL of the page the link goes to.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'display' property in CSS?
answers: To set the font size of text
To handle how an element is displayed on the page
To change the color of an element
To hide the element without removing it from the DOM
questions.explanation: The 'display' property in CSS specifies how an element is displayed in the document. It can be set to values like 'block', 'inline', 'flex', etc., to control the layout.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a closing tag in HTML?
answers: To add attributes to an element
questions.explanation: HTML elements typically use a start tag (opening tag) and an end tag (closing tag) with content in between. The closing tag marks the end of the element.

questions.question: Which HTTP status code indicates that the server cannot find the requested resource?
questions.explanation: The HTTP status code '404' means 'Not Found', indicating that the server can't find the requested resource.

questions.question: Which of the following are correct ways to declare a variable in JavaScript? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: 'var', 'let', and 'const' are used in JavaScript to declare variables. 'int' is not a valid keyword in JavaScript.

questions.question: What does the '===' operator do in JavaScript?
answers: Compares two values ignoring their types
Compares two values and their types
Assigns a value to a variable
questions.explanation: The '===' operator compares both the values and the types of two variables. It's known as the strict equality operator.

questions.question: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property in CSS is used to change the color of text. The 'background-color' is for changing the background color.

questions.question: In TypeScript, what is the purpose of interfaces?
answers: To create a new data type
To define a contract that an object or class must follow
questions.explanation: Interfaces in TypeScript define a contract that an object or class must comply with. They are not an actual part of the output JavaScript code but help in defining object shapes.

questions.question: What is the primary role of the <head> section in an HTML document?
answers: To define where the HTML document begins
To contain metadata and links to scripts and stylesheets
To display content on the webpage
questions.explanation: The <head> section is where metadata, links to CSS and JavaScript files, and the page title are defined. It prepares the page's setup before content rendering.

questions.question: Which of the following methods is used to add an event listener to an HTML element in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The '.addEventListener()' method is used to attach an event handler to an HTML element for modern browsers. 'attachEvent()' is deprecated.

questions.question: How do you comment out a single line in CSS?
questions.explanation: CSS supports comments delimited by '/*' to start and '*/' to end the comment. Single-line comments are written the same way.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid way to incorporate JavaScript into an HTML page?
questions.explanation: <js></js> is not a valid HTML tag for including JavaScript. The <script> tag is the proper tag to use.

questions.question: What JavaScript method is used to convert a JSON string into an object?
questions.explanation: The 'JSON.parse()' method parses a JSON string and constructs the JavaScript value or object described by the string.

questions.question: How would you select an element with the class name 'example' in CSS?
questions.explanation: In CSS, the '.' selector is used to select elements by their class attribute. '.example' targets elements with the class 'example'.

questions.question: When using the box model in CSS, what is the correct order of box properties from the inside out?
questions.explanation: In the CSS box model, the structure from the innermost to the outermost is: Content, Padding, Border, and Margin.

questions.question: What tag would best suit displaying tabular data in HTML?
questions.explanation: The <table> tag is the standard tag for displaying tabular data in HTML. It allows for structured data presentation using related tags like <tr>, <td>, and <th>.

questions.question: What will 'console.log(2 + "2")' output in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: JavaScript will convert the number 2 to a string and concatenate, not add, resulting in the string '22'.

questions.question: How can you make a list in HTML with bullets?
questions.explanation: The <ul> tag creates an unordered list with bullet points. It's distinct from an ordered list, which uses <ol> and numbers.

questions.question: What is the default display property of a <div> element in CSS?
questions.explanation: By default, the <div> element is a block-level element, occupying the full width available and creating a line break before and after it.
